sect1.title: Presets
sect1.para: This menu gives you an overview of the presets that are defined for darktable's modules. In this dialog you can select whether a certain user defined preset shall be auto-applied to matching images.
darktable already comes with a set of pre-defined presets for several modules. In addition you can define your own presets from within each module in darkroom mode (see ).
Pre-defined presets are shown with a lock symbol. Their auto-apply properties can not be changed.
Double clicking on a user-defined preset will open a menu.

sect4.title: auto apply this preset to matching images
sect4.para: activate this checkbutton to make the preset be auto applied to newly imported images; a set of fields is displayed where you can define patterns to be matched against EXIF data.

sect4.title: only show this preset for matching images
sect4.para: activate this checkbutton to hide the preset in darkroom mode if it does not match the defined patterns.

sect4.title: model
sect4.para: a pattern to be matched against the EXIF field that describes your camera model; use "%" as wildcard.

sect4.title: maker
sect4.para: a pattern to be matched against the EXIF field that describes the maker of your camera; use "%" as wildcard.

sect4.title: lens
sect4.para: a pattern to be matched against the EXIF field that describes your lens; use "%" as wildcard.

sect4.title: iso
sect4.para: only apply the preset if the iso value of your image lies within the given range.

sect4.title: exposure
sect4.para: only apply the preset if the exposure time of your image lies within the given range; set "+" as the upper value to match arbitrarily long exposures.

sect4.title: aperture
sect4.para: only apply the preset if the aperture of your image lies within the given range; set "f/0" as the lower value to match arbitrarily open apertures; set "f/+" as the upper value to match arbitrarily closed apertures.

sect4.title: focal length
sect4.para: only apply the preset if the focal length of your image lies within the given range (from 0 to 1000).
